answers.answer: In my opinion, as a nurse, I would go in. With the swelling and the increase in BP you don't want to wait. Good luck mama.

I experienced this with my daughter.  My blood pressures were much higher though, but still not preeclampsia, I never got that just gestational hypertension.  I experienced all of the same symptoms you explained, and was put on bed rest for the last trimester. With this pregnancy my blood pressures are running where you said yours are at and they say its fine, and its just the high side of normal, although I still have to check every day, andthey are kkeeping a close eye on me, but no bedrest. I was told that if you have a headache that wont go away with tylenol orb your blood pressure is really high you need to go in. If your number is a lot higher than it has been go in. Its better to be safe.

This is my 2nd pregnancy with preeclamplsia and my dr likes to see me when my bp reaches 140/90. It usually just means he has to increase my bp meds but he needs to know so that he can monitor baby and check protein levels haven't suddenly increased. I would go in. Good luck!

Up until yesterday, the highest it had been was 120/80. I have been in bed all day. So it isn't as if I have been doing anything to cause it to go up. I'm feeling very frustrated because I told my doctor yesterday how I was feeling and got the "wait and see response". It really felt like she wasn't taking me seriously. And now I feel worse today. And her office is closed until Monday.
And I don't know if it makes any difference but my son is measuring large. He is measuring 4 weeks ahead. I don't have gestational diabetes. Just a big baby.

I would stay in the bed with my feet up,  drink plenty of water and stay away from anything with salt or fried. I've been on bed rest pretty much my entire last trimester due to hypertension and it was much higher than what you're reading. Truly staying off my feet and taking it easy was the only thing that stabilized it
I would go in. It is best to be checked and have a clear head, than to sit, think and stress yourself.Hopefully all will be well

question: I am nearly 32 weeks pregnant and considered high risk. My blood pressure has been up and down for almost the last couple of months and my doc finally put me on bed rest the week of Halloween. I haven't been feeling good the last couple of days (headache that won't go away, nausea, spotty vision) and I went to see my dr yesterday. She told me to stay off my feet and ordered another preeclampsia test for after the holiday weekend. There hasn't been any protein in my urine yet. And my bp was 136/84. Today I woke up feeling worse. And now I have some swelling. My fingers actually ache from it now. So I took my bp and it is 142/96. I don't want to overreact. But I also don't know if this is something I should head to the hospital over. I really need some advice on how to handle this.
title: Need advice please!
